text.p: The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Vast changes sought to aid natives: Action proposed on land claims, broken treaty promises, creation of aboriginal parliament.
- Prime Minister's past suggests caution: Report's recommendations overwhelm cabinet.
- Ontario not obligated to fund religious schools: Supreme Court's decision upsets minority groups.
- Winter wreaks havoc in the West: Temperature hits -44 in Alberta.
- Rwandan couple refuse to hate: Francois and Marie-Rose survived the massacres in which 30 family members died. Trying to create a future, they live in fear.
- Trimac to split operations: Two firms to emerge from reorganization inspired by investor dislike of conglomerates.
- Altamira managers to hit jackpot in takeover: Top eight executives will pocket millions, documents show.
- TrizecHahn buys Houston complex: Peter Munk's firm one of top landlords in city.
- Ad agency buys shop to target retail trade: Bozell to reduce multinational reliance.
- DMR to hire up to 500 in hard-pressed Montreal.
- Bre-X shares jump on hint of takeover.
- Veronika Hirsch affair spurring tougher standards for fund managers.
